roomTip: The sea is too rough for swimming, with a very steep bank down to the waters edge.
text:
We stayed at the Coco Royal Beach Resort for 3 weeks from 14th February,  2024 on an all inclusive basis (wine is NOT all inclusive). Its a basic hotel, with friendly staff and a beachfront location.  The rooms are huge, either ground or first floor with terrace or balcony and located surrounding a large patch of grass with a large, well maintained swimming pool at one end.

The hotel is under new ownership and improvements and changes were being made throughout our stay.

There are no hairdyers in the rooms, but I was able to borrow one from reception for the duration of my holiday.   Rooms are cleaned and towels replaced daily.  Sometimes the sheets, pillowcases  and towels were a bit grubby looking, but we were assured they were clean, they smelt clean.

The hotel laundry service is fast, very good and  reasonably priced.

All rooms have a fridge which we were grateful for as the beer from the bar was not cold enough for us,  there was no problem in us taking unopened beers and mixers to the room to get colder.  I took some ice cube bags with me and made ice in my room too (thank goodness I did, as the ice machine in the bar was regularly out of action).  There are tea and coffee making facilities in each room ( the tea bags provided are lovely).  Bottled water is provided daily and as needed.  The water from the tap is good for making tea and coffee and brushing teeth.  There are a variety of different plug sockets in the room (UK, EU and old style round 3 pin), a universal adapter was provided.

The restaurant was OK with buffet style at breakfast with someone to cook eggs/omelette, a bit more practice is required to get fried eggs cooked to personal liking, but they did try.   Dinner was also buffet style.   The food was good, but could have been hotter at times.  Salads were fresh, soup was always tasty.  The curries and rices were delicious, I particularly liked the daal fry.   The papadums with lime pickle and mango chutney were always good.  

The hotel were trialling a set menu for lunchtime,  whereby  staff members would ask guests individually their meal preferences from a couple of choices for each course.  It prevented waste and was generally good. 

A railway line at the front of the hotel runs parallel to the beach but noise from this is minimal.  You can cross the railway line on foot, just outside the hotel for quicker access to the main road that leads to Colombo in one direction and Galle in the other.  Buses are cheap and frequent and sometimes a white knuckle experience.  There are tuktuks outside the hotel gates that for a negotiated price, will take you wherever you want to go.  

The hotel will provide a breakfast bag on request for those going on trips with early starts. 

We booked our holiday with Tui and felt it was good value.  Their excursions, however,  were over priced.  We booked a 2 night, 3 day excursion locally,  via Buddka at the Green Bamboo bar.  Our excursion was amazing value, just the two of us too, and included far more than the Tui excursion for ¬£55 less per person.  

Finally, a shout out to Kanishka Maduvanga and Ashen Madu at the bar, Akila in the restaurant and Ragu and Bradley on reception.
title: Work in progress

placeInfo: {'id': '8356701', 'name': 'Coco Royal Beach Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 499, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.613645, 'longitude': 79.947205, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d8356701-Reviews-Coco_Royal_Beach_Resort-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://cocoroyalbeach.com/', 'address': 'Beach Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Beach Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 21, 'count2': 24, 'count3': 53, 'count4': 174, 'count5': 227}}
text:
My husband and I have just returned to the UK from a wonderful 3 weeks holiday at the Coco Royal Beach Hotel in Kalutura, Sri Lanka. We were in room 211 from the 19th February till the 11th March 2024.
When we arrived at the hotel 6.30am in the morning, the Manager Mr Randun was waiting to welcome us such a nice man. During our stay he was always asking if all was ok and if there was anything he could do for us. He was waiting to say goodbye and wish us a safe journey home when we were leaving too.
Ragu the receptionist checked us in, such a lovely young man always had a beaming smile and so helpful throughout our stay. So was his supervisor Bradley.
We were shown to our room by the House keeping Manager Kosala yet another polite and helpful young man always asking if there was anything he could do for us.  Our room was large with a balcony overlooking the beach and sea.  All his staff who cleaned our room did an excellent job.
We went to the pool where we met more helpful people the pool attendants Nuwan, Manoj and Chandika who couldn't do enough for us and everyone else.
At dinner and breakfast the restaurant managers Akila and Suchira and their staff was so good. Nothing was any trouble to them all they wanted to do was make us happy and enjoy our meals.
The Barman who rounded off our evenings with the best cocktails ever and the best Aarack cocktail was Kanishka.
All the staff at this hotel are absolutely amazing, very hardworking and wonderful people who always greeted you with a smile and nothing was too much trouble for them.
The hotel has recently been taken over about a week before we arrived and will be renamed shortly. Already upgrades are taking place so any shortfalls will be improved.  We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.
Thank you to all the staff at Coco Royal Beach Hotel for making our stay in Sri Lanka one we will not forget.
title: The staff in this hotel from Management down made our stay perfect. A brilliant holiday.

placeInfo: {'id': '8356701', 'name': 'Coco Royal Beach Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 499, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.613645, 'longitude': 79.947205, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d8356701-Reviews-Coco_Royal_Beach_Resort-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://cocoroyalbeach.com/', 'address': 'Beach Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Beach Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 21, 'count2': 24, 'count3': 53, 'count4': 174, 'count5': 227}}
roomTip: Ask for a room on floor four. Best views of sea and sunset
text:
This is a three star hotel and so set your expectations accordingly and also that three star SL is not like the UK. The one factor that made this hotel stand out was the superb staff. Special mentions to Akila the Bar Captain who is simply amazing. Nothing is too much for him and he truly truly care about his guests. He should be in a more senior position for me and soon. The new GM (sorry no name) is brilliant. Available all the time, very visible and despite having only been there a few weeks he is making huge change and a making great difference. The brand new barman is also a breath of fresh air - bar now clean and drinks in stock and well made. 

Our first few days were a bit like Fawlty Towers with room not cleaned and drinks running out. It did though became clear why as the hotel was sold whilst we were there and the new multi millionaire owner arrived to meet the staff. In the final few days there was noticeable change - a new fence installed by the beach, new lights fitted to the pool and massive painting underway inside and outside the rooms and no drinks shortages at all. 

To be clear we  had some issues at the hotel as we were AI via TUI and there was no snack bar as advertised, drinks sid run out and also no wine on AI. The latter being due to the rising cost of wine rising (as staff told us and other guests) and not due to it never being included as the TUi rep lied to us and others about. 

Food was tasty and the masseuse was also superb with an hour full body for just ¬£13!!!  Always plenty of beach towels and sunbeds and so never a risk to not have somewhere to lie down. Ladies on the beach by the gate are also brilliant and very reasonable for their clothing and also cheap fresh coconuts too. Don‚Äôt ignore them and share some love to them. 

This hotel has the chance to be amazing if the new GM gets supported. It‚Äôs small and so you get such a personal experience from the great staff. If it were mine I‚Äôd have the masseuse services advertised in every room with prices and also I‚Äôd get the snack bar open asap so the non AI guests will eat and drink there assuming you also get a menu with prices on display. 

If we had the final few days for the whole time then this three star hotel would have had a five rating and it was the staff - especially Aklia and the GM that gave them a four and not a three rating.

If you want a personal and authentic boutique hotel on the beach - this is for you.
title: Improving Daily

text:
My parents spent two weeks here in January 2024 and have come back feeling refreshed and energised.  Please take any negative reviews left here with a pinch of salt. 

The staff at this hotel work extremely hard to ensure the guests are fully catered for. 

The quality of food and variety was superb - plenty of seafood choices and freshly caught. Many compliments to the one of the chefs, Nimal, who went above and beyond during our stay.

Another shout out goes  to the management, in particular, the general manager Mr Randan- he, with his team, are working super hard to ensure that guests enjoy their stay in their whole entirety.

The location of this hotel is excellent - and right on the beach. My parents have told me that they will definitely return to this place in the future.
title: Superb hotel, will return again!

placeInfo: {'id': '8356701', 'name': 'Coco Royal Beach Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 499, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.613645, 'longitude': 79.947205, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d8356701-Reviews-Coco_Royal_Beach_Resort-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://cocoroyalbeach.com/', 'address': 'Beach Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Beach Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 21, 'count2': 24, 'count3': 53, 'count4': 174, 'count5': 227}}
roomTip: Don‚Äôt go here
text: 6 of us booked to stay at this hotel for two weeks with Tui, on arrival we were disappointed with the place but decided to give it the benefit and see how things went. The rooms were basic but clean, the food was just about ok but the real problems started with the all inclusive drinks package, on the first night they had no tonic water, second night no coke, then no sprite and then only two bottles of beer, the place was a joke, the only positive thing was Steven the bar man who seemed the only person in the hotel who had any idea what was going on. We contacted the hotel manager who informed us they were having issues with delivery of drinks and to bear with us. We contacted the Tui representative Milan who attempted to fob us off and said he would sort the drinks problem, we had noticed the advertised pool bar was actually a sleeping area for the security guard and had not reopened following COVID, the same with the other advertised facilities, the sun beds were either damaged or split and the place was very run down, eventually the Tui representative agreed to move us to another hotel an hour away, Milan from Tui asked us not to tell anyone else we were getting the move how dishonest and despicable is this for customer care and service. We moved to another hotel that was much better but we will never book another holiday with Tui they knew the state of the Co Co beach and are still sending people there.
title: Terrible

text: Exceeded my expectations in every aspect. The serene beachfront location, coupled with impeccable service, made my stay truly memorable. The staff's attention to detail, delicious cuisine, and comfortable accommodations showcased the resort's commitment to providing a top-notch experience. Pool area was so beautiful that made me didn‚Äôt want to leave. Beach was peaceful and calm. I highly recommend Coco Royal for a relaxing and luxurious getaway.
title: Best holiday ever

placeInfo: {'id': '8356701', 'name': 'Coco Royal Beach Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 499, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.613645, 'longitude': 79.947205, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d8356701-Reviews-Coco_Royal_Beach_Resort-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://cocoroyalbeach.com/', 'address': 'Beach Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Beach Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 21, 'count2': 24, 'count3': 53, 'count4': 174, 'count5': 227}}
text:
Its not 4*, it's a poor 3*.
Our room was dirty-smelly curtains, stains on the walls, stains on the linen, dirty mirrors and glass door, dirty baseboards, dust and webs on lamps, sticky surface of furniture (the paint/lacquers fault) , limescale on the bathroom floor, disgusting bin in the bathroom, uncleaned surfaces under the sink and in the shower. Linen changed only once a week. Only bath towels available, nothing more. 
Food: we only had breakfasts. There were 4 types of curry which was very tasty. But basic things for europeans like cheese were missing, also the staff in the Restaurant was poor. Basics like scrambled eggs were out quickly but the staff was just standing there doing nothing instead of bringing more eggs etc. There was no water for self service, waiters were supposed to pour it but most of the times they were chatting with each other instead of doing their jobs. The coffe/tea area was dirty. The coffee was bad. 
The pool area looks very nice, there are a lot of palmtrees, but sunbeds were incredibly old and most of them was broken.
The beach was very nice but local people camping there all day long were discouraging. The were obtrusing, brazen. They kept offering some trips, clothes, they kept standing there leaning on the fence and STARING on the people on the sunbeds. It was totally creepy. Sometimes a man with a monkey on a leash and a snake in a sack was coming there too. Hotel security was doing nothing about it. Also one of the security staff kept a bottle of alcohol under his chair so... 
Most of the stuff was nice and helpful like house keeping guys and Ragu from the reception.
There are people in the hotel trying to make it better after pandemic but it will take time. It should start with a deep cleaning of the rooms and restaurant. Also the reception looks very poor and creates a bad first impression (dirty wall, sticky counter, no decorations, some old and ugly chair). The hotel has a great potential but it needs a lot of work to become a good 4* hotel.
title: Not good

placeInfo: {'id': '10628005', 'name': 'Club Waskaduwa Beach Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 296, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.616225, 'longitude': 79.94573, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d10628005-Reviews-Club_Waskaduwa_Beach_Resort_Spa-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.clubwaskaduwabeachresort.com', 'address': '211 Jayanthi Mawatha (Parallel Road) Waskaduwa North, Waskaduwa, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '211 Jayanthi Mawatha (Parallel Road)', 'street2': 'Waskaduwa North, Waskaduwa', 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 35, 'count2': 21, 'count3': 37, 'count4': 71, 'count5': 132}}
text: The hotel is nice and cozy. The staff is super friendly and accommodating. We had gone for a chess tournament and the matches always ended late. The manager, Mohd Shahmir, made special arrangements for us to be able to use the pool after hours. The reception helped load the phones for us as our cards were not being accepted in Sri Lanka. The beach has nice sitting benches to enjoy the sea. July is a rough month for the sea so we could not swim but the views were breathtaking. I am sure this hotel is more hustling and bustling in the tourist season. One advice, buy your own water when you come. Hotels give only 2 half litre bottles a day and if you need more you have to buy except during meal times. In July it is very hot and humid. The super market is close and there are many small souvenir shops in the area. Tuk tuks are available at the gate at all times. Overall a nice experience.
title: Overall a good experience with minor set backs

placeInfo: {'id': '10628005', 'name': 'Club Waskaduwa Beach Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 296, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.616225, 'longitude': 79.94573, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d10628005-Reviews-Club_Waskaduwa_Beach_Resort_Spa-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.clubwaskaduwabeachresort.com', 'address': '211 Jayanthi Mawatha (Parallel Road) Waskaduwa North, Waskaduwa, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '211 Jayanthi Mawatha (Parallel Road)', 'street2': 'Waskaduwa North, Waskaduwa', 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 35, 'count2': 21, 'count3': 37, 'count4': 71, 'count5': 132}}
text: I had a very disappointing stay at this hotel. There were vermin in the fresh mango juice at breakfast, and the service was poor. Flies and mosquitoes were everywhere and died flies and mosquitoes on the buffet table and in food, and the pool was unclean. The hot water was only switched on after 5 p.m., and the lunch buffet was like a alms giving menu. The photos on the website seem outdated as the hotel is now old and unclean. I do not recommend this place
title: Not a recomended place

placeInfo: {'id': '10628005', 'name': 'Club Waskaduwa Beach Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 296, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.616225, 'longitude': 79.94573, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d10628005-Reviews-Club_Waskaduwa_Beach_Resort_Spa-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.clubwaskaduwabeachresort.com', 'address': '211 Jayanthi Mawatha (Parallel Road) Waskaduwa North, Waskaduwa, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '211 Jayanthi Mawatha (Parallel Road)', 'street2': 'Waskaduwa North, Waskaduwa', 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 35, 'count2': 21, 'count3': 37, 'count4': 71, 'count5': 132}}
roomTip: When leaving the room bring valuables with yourself. Count your money so you know if something was stolen.
text: Be careful with your money. Dont even leave it in the safe box. Take it with you at all times, otherwise some will be probably stolen. I forgot my wallet in the room and 50‚Ç¨ banknote was stolen. They paid me back after telling this matter to the manager. They can open safebox too so dont use it. Staff is unresponsive. You need to ask multiple times for them to finally bring you stuff. We didnt have safebox, fridge, cups etc. All other things in this hotel were ok. Hotel needs renovation but if youre not very fancy then your stay will be fine.
title: Make sure to not leave valuable stuff inside the room!

placeInfo: {'id': '10628005', 'name': 'Club Waskaduwa Beach Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 296, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.616225, 'longitude': 79.94573, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d10628005-Reviews-Club_Waskaduwa_Beach_Resort_Spa-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.clubwaskaduwabeachresort.com', 'address': '211 Jayanthi Mawatha (Parallel Road) Waskaduwa North, Waskaduwa, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '211 Jayanthi Mawatha (Parallel Road)', 'street2': 'Waskaduwa North, Waskaduwa', 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 35, 'count2': 21, 'count3': 37, 'count4': 71, 'count5': 132}}

placeInfo: {'id': '10628005', 'name': 'Club Waskaduwa Beach Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 296, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.616225, 'longitude': 79.94573, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d10628005-Reviews-Club_Waskaduwa_Beach_Resort_Spa-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.clubwaskaduwabeachresort.com', 'address': '211 Jayanthi Mawatha (Parallel Road) Waskaduwa North, Waskaduwa, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '211 Jayanthi Mawatha (Parallel Road)', 'street2': 'Waskaduwa North, Waskaduwa', 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 35, 'count2': 21, 'count3': 37, 'count4': 71, 'count5': 132}}
text: Garden view room comes with train noises! Hotel room was filled with little ants so don't leave anything eatable there. Toilet water button was very hard to push. Even we asked for clean towels every day during our stay there, the new towels were not very clean-it was not clear if they were washed or just dried. Our group also experienced some things gone missing from rooms. We had an sweet treat in the fridge-it went missing after the room cleaning. In other room a person had 600 rupeed next to computer-it was taken away. In the next room halp bottle on whiskey was taken away from the fridge and also 60 english pounds from the lock box. The breakfast was so-so, dinner was quite good. Overall-the hotel is quite new but it is not using it's true potential - Spa, rooftop restaurant and other restaurant is closed, room is little tired. Poolside was okay but if you plan to go to sea-be warned as the waves are high and locals try to sell you everything all the time.
title: Not the best but it is okay

placeInfo: {'id': '10628005', 'name': 'Club Waskaduwa Beach Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 296, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.616225, 'longitude': 79.94573, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d10628005-Reviews-Club_Waskaduwa_Beach_Resort_Spa-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.clubwaskaduwabeachresort.com', 'address': '211 Jayanthi Mawatha (Parallel Road) Waskaduwa North, Waskaduwa, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '211 Jayanthi Mawatha (Parallel Road)', 'street2': 'Waskaduwa North, Waskaduwa', 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 35, 'count2': 21, 'count3': 37, 'count4': 71, 'count5': 132}}
roomTip: Skip this hotel and change the place in the island downstares.
text:
Hotel pluses:

Very friendly and good hotel staff.
They let people bring their own drinks and brought them glasses and ice cream.
The room with a sea view was normal, comfortable bed, nice food.

Hotel minuses:
First if all the hotel does not match the photos. From the pictures tou can see that The hotel has a view of palm trees and a sea view, but it is actually overgrown with shrubs, the palm trees are cutting and the sea view is not even visible through the overgrown shrubs.
Bad location. The hotel is untidy and dirty. Sewage leaking in the middle of the hotel's lawn.
Beach towels are collected after the day, not washed but dried, and given to customers the next morning.
Rooms are not cleaning. 

Every day something keeps breaking or not working. If you ask to fix- they agree but do nothing. 

In general, I understand that Asia has different standards and procedures, but the hygiene here is very deplorable.

The beach are not comfortable and very unsightly.I will never come back to this hotel.;)
Every day russian music. No another music only russian.
title: Poor russian hotel

placeInfo: {'id': '316669', 'name': 'Hibiscus Beach Hotel', 'rating': 3.5, 'numberOfReviews': 246, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.615206, 'longitude': 79.946724, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d316669-Reviews-Hibiscus_Beach_Hotel-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.hibiscusbeachhotel.com/', 'address': 'Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': '', 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 21, 'count2': 21, 'count3': 43, 'count4': 86, 'count5': 75}}
roomTip: Rooms are old, doors creak, locks don't work, there is an odor in the room always.
text: We stayed at Hotel Hibiscus during a recent visit to Sri Lanka. The resort was located at a great location at Waskaduwa in Kalutara. The property featured rooms and villas with a swimming pool for adults and children. The villas had a seperate swimming pool as well. The check-in experience was decent. The rooms were a major let down, The walls were patched up and the bathroom ceiling showed signs of seepage with green spots quite prominent. The water had a sort of stink though the shower worked well and hot water was available all the while. The room had sand in the corners, the bed was not super comfortable though I would still give it a thumbs-up. The room service staff were hard working, but, well, if the walls and ceilings leak, what could they do? Another family reported a lizard in their room and their main switch tripped when they turned on the electric kettle. The electrician came down immediately and even offered to change the room, which was really great. The beach was next door, literally at stones throw distance and there were enough taps and mats to wash off sand. The breakfast spread was good, the lunch and dinner a-la-carte menu was quite decent. Plus point - EXCELLENT restaurant staff who helped adjust the meal for us. The swimming pools were really good. Major negative point - VISA cards did not work, only Mastercard did. The check-out experience was also decent. Overall, there are other resorts around, but the restaurant staff could be the only reason why I could recommend the resort to anybody. This place needs to be renovated ASAP!
title: Rickety rooms inside, awesome beach outside

placeInfo: {'id': '3310513', 'name': 'The Plantation Villa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 385, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.552944, 'longitude': 80.06062, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d3310513-Reviews-The_Plantation_Villa-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.srimalplantation.com', 'address': 'Wattalaya watta, Nehinna, Dodangoda, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wattalaya watta, Nehinna, Dodangoda', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 11, 'count4': 60, 'count5': 308}}
text: I booked the Ayurveda package at Plantation Villa for the second time, and after just 6 days, I felt like a completely new person! My room had a stunning jungle view, making it so peaceful and relaxing in the middle of nature. The Ayurvedic food was fantastic, and the treatments were top-notch. My therapist, Vasana, was always smiling, radiating the best vibes, and gave me the most amazing massages. She was so caring and attentive throughout my stay. Yoga and meditation with Bernardo were also incredible, adding to the overall rejuvenation. I highly recommend this place to anyone seeking a truly healing retreat!
title: Transformative Healing at Plantation Villa: A Rejuvenating 6-Day Ayurvedic Retreat in Nature's Embrace

placeInfo: {'id': '3310513', 'name': 'The Plantation Villa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 385, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.552944, 'longitude': 80.06062, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d3310513-Reviews-The_Plantation_Villa-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.srimalplantation.com', 'address': 'Wattalaya watta, Nehinna, Dodangoda, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wattalaya watta, Nehinna, Dodangoda', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 11, 'count4': 60, 'count5': 308}}

Rooms clean and adequate. Location charming. Meeting the Monk was very special. Food was set with tea freely available; Was enough for me but some were still a little hungry so something to consider if you have a large appetite. A great place to contemplate life

placeInfo: {'id': '3310513', 'name': 'The Plantation Villa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 385, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.552944, 'longitude': 80.06062, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d3310513-Reviews-The_Plantation_Villa-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.srimalplantation.com', 'address': 'Wattalaya watta, Nehinna, Dodangoda, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wattalaya watta, Nehinna, Dodangoda', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 11, 'count4': 60, 'count5': 308}}
text: I wanted to say I had a wonderful stay at Plantation villa. I went due to serious back pain that I had been having for many many months that no dr. could tell me why and what was wrong.  I decided to take some time off to rest and do some natural treatments and see how things went.  The time there was so restful and full of the kindest people and very nice treatments. All the oil massages were great for my back pain. I learned a lot through discussions with Barnardo who manages the place, teaches yoga and also gives very interesting talks on so many different subjects.  No idea where he gets his wisdom, but guessing its a gift. I was kind of down due to my back pain but he kept encouraging me that from all he could see and tell, I for sure would get better but it was going to take time. I just want to say at the time of writing this I am 100% better and so very happy and thankful to not be in pain! Thank you all there for all the care you showed me and all I learned and most of all for helping me on my healing journey. I know I benefited greatly from that time!  Be blessed and THANK YOU!
title: Thank you Plantation villa!
